page.title: 19SUNNISIDE NR. TOW LAW,DURHAM
page.content:
{Sunniside, like Tow Law a mile to the {west, is a former pit-village.}At one time many people lived here. Today however, houses have been pulled down and there are now large gaps where once rows of terraced houses stood.
There are few amenities here as shopping is carried out in Tow Law or in Crook (3 miles).
Behind one of the pubs on the main road through the village there is a disused{miner's handball court.}A huge self-supported wall, there are vague plans to bring it back into use.
The houses on the southern edge have extensive views over the valley of the River Wear.
